METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: The date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the beginning of the event (e.g., cruise).
The date (MM/DD/YYYY) and time (HH:MM) of the haul. All dates and times are in Alaska time (AKDT) of Anchorage, AK, USA (UTC/GMT -8 hours).
The date (MM/DD/YYYY) and time (HH:MM) of the end of the haul. All dates and times are in Alaska time (AKDT) of Anchorage, AK, USA (UTC/GMT -8 hours).
The date (MM/DD/YYYY) and time (HH:MM) of the beginning of the haul. All dates and times are in Alaska time (AKDT) of Anchorage, AK, USA (UTC/GMT -8 hours).
Depth of gear (meters).
Bottom depth (meters).
Maximum depth (meters).
Minimum depth (meters).
Description of row observation.
Year ID associated with a given value AREA_ID. This field describes the changes in the survey design over time.
Chemical specimen currently stored in
Distance the net fished (kilometers).
dummy.
This is the elapsed time between start and end of a haul (decimal hours).
Phylogenetic latin rank of family of a given species.
Frequency, or count, of an observation.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Type of gear used on the net
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Type of gear used on net. For a complete list of gear ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Depth gear was deployed at (tenths of a meter). Gear depth plus net height equals bottom depth.

Type of trawl or gear deployed. For a complete list of vessel gear type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Temperature recorded by net gear (tenths of a degree Celsius); NA indicates removed or missing values.
Phylogenetic latin rank of genus of a given species.
Weight of specimen gonads (grams).
This number uniquely identifies a sampling event (haul) within a cruise. It is a sequential number, in chronological order of occurrence.

Type of haul sampling method. For a complete list of haul type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
This is a unique numeric identifier assigned to each (vessel, cruise, and haul) combination.
Taxonomist(s) who re-identified specimen(s)
Lowest taxonomic rank of a given species entry.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Integrated taxonomic information system (ITIS) serial number
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Species code as identified in the Integrated Taxonomic Information System (https://itis.gov/).
Phylogenetic latin rank of kingdom of a given species.
Latitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree).
Latitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree) of the end of the haul.
Latitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree) of the start of the haul.
Length bin in millimeters. A length of -9 indicates cases where no lengths were collected within a stratum for a species/year, even though catch numbers were recorded.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Mean length at age weighted by numbers at length
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Mean length (millimeters).

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Standard deviation of length at age weighted by numbers at length
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Variance of mean length.

How the taxon was measured (e.g., fork length, carapace width). For a complete list of length_type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Longitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree).
Longitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree) of the end of the haul.
Longitude (one hundred thousandth of a decimal degree) of the start of the haul.
The maturity code or the condition identified by the maturity code.
Name of the column in a table.
Description of the column.
Long name for the column.
Oracle data type of data column.
Table metadata sentence.
Name of table metadata sentence.
Type of sentence to have in table metadata.
Units of the column.
Total number of hauls with positive count data.
Total number of hauls.
Total number of hauls with length data.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Number of specimens in the lot
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Number of specimens in the voucher lot
Total number of hauls with positive catch biomass.
Total number of hauls with positive sample collection.
Measured or estimated distance (meters) between footrope and headrope of the trawl.
Logical, describing if the net was measured (TRUE) or not (FALSE) by wheelhouse and marport programs during the haul.
Measured or estimated distance (meters) between wingtips of the trawl.
Confirmed taxonomist identification of the vouchered specimen
Phylogenetic latin rank of order of a given species.
Field identification for the vouchered specimen

This denotes what, if any, issues arose during the haul. For more information, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Phylogenetic latin rank of phylum of a given species.
The estimated population caught in the survey for a species, group, or total for a given survey.
The estimated population variance caught in the survey for a species, group, or total for a given survey.
First and last name of principal investigator for a project.
Special project title.
Special project short title (short version of PROJECT_TITLE).
The taxonomic rank of a taxon identification.
Reason for taxonomic change; pulled directly from online database (i.e. WoRMS or ITIS)

Sampling information on how the taxon was sampled. For a complete list of length_type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).

The scientific name of the organism associated with the common_name and species_code columns. For a complete taxon list, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Sex of a specimen where "1" = "Male", "2" = "Female", "3" = Unsexed.

The species code of the organism associated with the common_name and scientific_name columns. For a complete species list, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Scientific name of species.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Scientific name used in taxonomic database
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Scientific name of species used in taxonomic "DATABASE" column.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Scientific name used in survey data
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Scientific name of species historically or currently used in the survey.
Each individual examined must have a number assigned to it that is unique within each haul (0001 to 9999), though specimen numbers may be repeated between hauls

The specimen sample type ID key code as defined in the RACE_DATA.SPECIMEN_SAMPLE_TYPES table. For a complete list of Specimen sample type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
For a complete list of specimen subsample method ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).

Abbreviated survey names. The column srvy is associated with the survey and survey_definition_id columns. Northern Bering Sea (NBS), Southeastern Bering Sea (EBS), Bering Sea Slope (BSS), Gulf of Alaska (GOA), Aleutian Islands (AI).
Standard length of specimen or range of lengths if multiple specimens in lot; measured by taxonomists in lab
Alpha-numeric designation for the station established in the design of a survey.

RACE database statistical area for analyzing data. Strata were designed using bathymetry and other geographic and habitat-related elements. The strata are unique to each survey region. Stratum of value 0 indicates experimental tows.
Phylogenetic latin rank of subclass of a given species.
Phylogenetic latin rank of subfamily of a given species.
Date special projects were due to be submitted for the upcoming survey season.
Phylogenetic latin rank of suborder of a given species.
Phylogenetic latin rank of subphylum of a given species.
Phylogenetic latin rank of superclass of a given species.
Phylogenetic latin rank of superfamily of a given species.
Phylogenetic latin rank of superorder of a given species.
Surface temperature (tenths of a degree Celsius); NA indicates removed or missing values.
Name and description of survey. The column survey is associated with the srvy and survey_definition_id columns.

The survey definition ID key code is an integer that uniquely identifies a survey region/survey design. The column survey_definition_id is associated with the srvy and survey columns. Full list of survey definition IDs are in RACE_DATA.SURVEY_DEFINITIONS and in the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
The survey ID uniquely identifies a survey instance.
Designates whether or not species name is accepted/actively used in the RACE surveys

Confidence in the ability of the survey team to correctly identify the taxon to the specified level, based solely on identification skill (e.g., not likelihood of a taxon being caught at that station on a location-by-location basis). Quality codes follow: **High**: High confidence and consistency. Taxonomy is stable and reliable at this level, and field identification characteristics are well known and reliable. **Moderate**: Moderate confidence. Taxonomy may be questionable at this level, or field identification characteristics may be variable and difficult to assess consistently. **Low**: Low confidence. Taxonomy is incompletely known, or reliable field identification characteristics are unknown. Documentation: [Species identification confidence in the eastern Bering Sea shelf survey (1982-2008)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2009-04.pdf), [Species identification confidence in the eastern Bering Sea slope survey (1976-2010)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2014-05.pdf), and [Species identification confidence in the Gulf of Alaska and Aleutian Islands surveys (1980-2011)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2014-01.pdf).

Confidence in the ability of the survey team to correctly identify the taxon to the specified level, based solely on identification skill (e.g., not likelihood of a taxon being caught at that station on a location-by-location basis). Quality codes follow: **High**: High confidence and consistency. Taxonomy is stable and reliable at this level, and field identification characteristics are well known and reliable. **Moderate**: Moderate confidence. Taxonomy may be questionable at this level, or field identification characteristics may be variable and difficult to assess consistently. **Low**: Low confidence. Taxonomy is incompletely known, or reliable field identification characteristics are unknown. Documentation: [Species identification confidence in the eastern Bering Sea shelf survey (1982-2008)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2009-04.pdf), [Species identification confidence in the eastern Bering Sea slope survey (1976-2010)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2014-05.pdf), and [Species identification confidence in the Gulf of Alaska and Aleutian Islands surveys (1980-2011)](http://apps-afsc.fisheries.noaa.gov/Publications/ProcRpt/PR2014-01.pdf).
Logical, describing if stations are trawlable (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

A call sign is a designated sequence of letters and numbers that are assigned when a vessel, whether it be a sailing yacht, motor yacht, rib or commercial vessel, receives its Ship Radio Licence. The vessel also receives its MMSI number, so that each vessel is uniquely identified.

Official Identification number as defined by www.dco.uscg.mil. The Official Number (O/N) is the 6 or 7 digit number awarded to the vessel at the time it is first documented with the US Coast Guard. This number remains with the vessel indefinitely and should be marked in accordance with 46 CFR 67.121.

ID number of the vessel used to collect data for that haul. The column vessel_id is associated with the vessel_name column. Note that it is possible for a vessel to have a new name but the same vessel id number. For a complete list of vessel ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).

The International Maritime Organization (IMO) number consists of the letters "IMO" followed by a unique, seven-digit number: the pattern is "NNNNNNN", where N is a single-digit number, e.g., "1234567"
The length of vessel in meters.

Maritime Mobile Service Identities (MMSIs) are nine-digit numbers used by maritime digital selective calling (DSC), automatic identification systems (AIS) and certain other equipment to uniquely identify a ship or a coast radio station.

Name of the vessel used to collect data for that haul. The column vessel_name is associated with the vessel_id column. Note that it is possible for a vessel to have a new name but the same vessel id number. For a complete list of vessel ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Name of vessel owner or company.
The tonnage of vessel in metric tons.
The voucher number of the specimen within a single haul
Weight of specimen (grams).
Weight (thousandths of a kilogram) of individuals in a haul by taxon.
Length of wire deployed during a given haul in meters.

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: World register of marine species (WoRMS) taxonomic serial number
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Species code as identified in the World Register of Marine Species (WoRMS) (https://www.marinespecies.org/).
Year the observation (survey) was collected.

Age bin of taxon. Age bin of a taxon in years estimated by the age comp estimate. Age -9 indicates unaged lengths for a particular sex because no otoliths were collected for that sex/length combination. Age -99 indicates a case where no lengths were collected within a stratum for a species/year even though catch numbers were recorded.

Numeric code corresponding to the method of age determination. For a complete list of age determination codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Long name of the survey conducted

A call sign is a designated sequence of letters and numbers that are assigned when a vessel, whether it be a sailing yacht, motor yacht, rib or commercial vessel, receives its Ship Radio Licence. The vessel also receives its MMSI number, so that each vessel is uniquely identified.
Well-known text (WKT) representation of geometry for a AREA_JOIN polygon. WKT is a text markup language for representing vector geometry objects.

Well-known binary (WKB) representation of geometry for a AREA_JOIN polygon. WKB is used to transfer and store the same information in a more compact form convenient for computer processing but that is not human-readable.
Taxonomic name previously used in the database
Species code associated with old species name
Updated taxonomic name
Species code associated with new species name
Standard action taken to alter current database record
Year change implemented in database
Infraorder phylogenetic rank. Phylogenetic latin rank of infraorder of a given speices.
Infraclass phylogenetic rank. Phylogenetic latin rank of infraclass of a given speices.
Museum catalog number associated with record
Spatial geometry information (like points, lines, or polygons) a feature.
Survey footprint, usually equivalent to the SURVEY_DEFINITION_ID with the exception of the Standard and Standard +NW survey footprints in the Eastern Bering Sea shelf bottom trawl survey.

Equivalent to the SPECIES_CODE if the taxon is reported as a single taxon in GAP_PRODUCTS, otherwise denotes a SPECIES_CODE of a higher taxonomic group to which the taxon is aggregated in the GAP_PRODUCTS CPUE and BIOMASS tables.
Logical, describing if this haul was conducted in a standard manner and thus used for design-based index estimates (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Type of gear accessories used on the net
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: Type of accessories used on net. For a complete list of accessories ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Logical, describing if a vessel is active (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
A unique ID used to identify this age determination method.
Age bin of a taxon in years estimated by the age comp estimate.
Abbreviated agencies that are affiliated with the Alaska bottom trawl survey. The column agency_acronym is associated with the agency_short and agency_long columns.
Affiliated agency ID key code.
Full official name of affiliated agencies to the Alaska bottom trawl survey. The column agency_long is associated with the agency_acronym and agency_short columns.
A sort version of the full official name of affiliated agencies to the Alaska bottom trawl survey. The column agency_short is associated with the agency_acronym and agency_long columns.
Area ID key code for each statistical area used to produce production estimates (e.g., biomass, population, age comps, length comps). Each area ID is unique within each survey.
Area in square kilometers.
Descriptive name of each AREA_ID. These names often identify the region, depth ranges, or other regional information for the area ID.
The area the net covered while the net was fishing (kilometers squared), defined as the distance fished times the net width.

The type of stratum that AREA_ID represents. Types include: STRATUM (the smallest building-block unit of area in these surveys), REGION, DEPTH, SUBAREA, INPFC BY DEPTH, INPFC, SUBAREA BY DEPTH, REGULATORY AREA, NMFS STATISTICAL AREA.
The estimated total biomass.
The estimated variance associated with the total biomass.
Bottom temperature (tenths of a degree Celsius); NA indicates removed or missing values.

Bottom type on sea floor at haul location. For a complete list of bottom type ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Unique integer ID assigned to each survey, vessel, year, and catch observation combination.
Phylogenetic latin rank of class of a given species.
Phylogenetic classification group rank for a given species.
Initials of person who collected specimen in the field
Comments regarding row observation.

The common name of the marine organism associated with the scientific_name and species_code columns. For a complete species list, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Total whole number of individuals caught in haul or samples collected.

Country ID key code of where a vessel, for example, may be from. For a complete list of country ID key codes, review the [code books](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/resource/document/groundfish-survey-species-code-manual-and-data-codes-manual).
Catch weight (kilograms) per unit effort (area swept by the net, units hectares).
Catch weight (kilograms) per unit effort (area swept by the net, units square kilometers).
The mean catch weight (kilograms) per unit effort (area swept by the net, units squared kilometers).

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Variance of the mean weight CPUE
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: The variance of mean catch weight (kilograms) per unit effort (area swept by the net, units squared kilometers).
Numerical catch per unit effort (area swept by the net, units hectares).
Numerical catch per unit effort (area swept by the net, units square kilometers).
The mean of numerical catch per unit effort (area swept by the net, units square kilometers).

METADATA_COLNAME_LONG: Variance of the mean numeric CPUE
METADATA_COLNAME_DESC: The variance of mean numerical catch per unit effort (area swept by the net, units square kilometers).
The coordinate reference system (CRS) that shapefiles were created in or areas (like AREA_KM2) are calculated in, as defined by https://spatialreference.org/ (e.g., "+proj=longlat", "EPSG:3338").

This is a six-digit integer identifying the cruise number of the form: YYYY99 (where YYYY = year of the cruise; 99 = 2-digit number and is sequential; 01 denotes the first cruise that vessel made in this year, 02 is the second, etc.).
Unique integer ID assigned to each survey, vessel, and year combination.
Taxonomic database source, either ITIS or WoRMS.
Species ID key code of a species in the taxonomic "DATABASE" source.
The date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the event (e.g., cruise).
The date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the end of the event (e.g., cruise).
